## Deep Value Benchmark: Measuring Whether Models Generalize Deep Values or Shallow Preferences

Understanding AI's deep values is a crucial step in ensuring that our artificial assistants truly grasp the intentions behind our actions, rather than just picking up on superficial preferences. Researchers at the University of Michigan and NYU Shanghai conducted an experiment to test this capability. They mixed up deep values like justice, honesty, or compassion with shallow preferences in one experiment, and then reversed the pattern in another.

Out of nine large language models tested, AI struggled to understand deeper human values when presented with new choices. This highlights a significant gap between AI's ability to pick up on patterns versus their understanding of our deep values behind those patterns. The researchers discovered that while these models are excellent at identifying patterns in behavior and preferences, they struggle to grasp the subtleties and implications of our true intentions.

The impact of this discovery is profound as we integrate more AI into our lives: if an AI model suggests choices based solely on surface-level preferences, it risks missing out on opportunities that align with deeper human values. The study provides a tool to measure this gap and raises important questions about the integration of AI into our daily lives—and how well it can truly understand us.

As we continue to rely more heavily on AI in our lives, it's essential to ensure that these technologies are not only capable of understanding surface-level preferences but also able to grasp the deeper values that guide our decisions and actions. The future of AI looks promising as researchers strive to bridge this gap, but for now, we must remain mindful of the limitations of these technologies in fully comprehending human behavior and intentions.

Remember, next time you interact with an AI or chatbot: while they may not be as smart as we think at figuring out your deep values—yet—they are learning, and their future will certainly catch up with smarter AIs.
